hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1358 a and today's date is
August 18th 2017 and the title of the
episode is the economic system is
breaking down one sector at a time now
before I get started I have two
announcements there was no report on
Thursday because my site both of my
sites x22 report calm and new Sentinel
calm they were being heavily attacked
they were brought down and they were
down for quite a while I was able to
bring x-22 report calm back up I was
able to fix it new Sentinel that was
damaged a little bit more so what I'm
going to do is I'm going to redesign
that site since it's down anyhow and I
needed to make it fixes anyhow so that
site is going to be coming up in a
couple of days and my second
announcement is that I uploaded an
interview with London poll on external
reports spotlight YouTube channel so you
can go over there and you can see and
listen to the interview you can also go
to my site x-22 Airport comm site scroll
down a little bit you'll see it on the
right-hand side or you can go to steam
it it is on there and you can watch the
video there let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now what's very
interesting is that as we're looking at
the economy we're following the economy
we've been reporting on the economy
we've been noticing that each economic
sector is declining at its own pace and
some sectors are a lot worse than others
but what's very interesting is that most
of them I would say the majority of them
they are declining now we know that the
manufacturing industry the automobile
industry has been pumped up we know how
they've been doing it they realize what
they've been doing we know that to sell
their automobiles they're giving a huge
amount of incentives they're bringing in
the sub-prime of subprime people just
trying to push the cars off the lot and
what's very interesting about all this
Equifax chief economist Amy Cruz cuts
well she pointed out that in 2016 and
deels are mysteriously performing more
like 2007 securitizations than those
underwritten in 2010 and what you said
is we're seeing an increase in
delinquencies across all credit scores
but in the highest credit quality is
just a basis point or two in deep
subprime the rise is more substantial
what stood out to me was the issuers
those that have been doing this for a
decade or more
we're showing the better performance
while those that were relative newcomers
were in the worst category and what
we're seeing is that these automobile
deals these incentives they are pushing
it towards the people with sub subprime
so if we look at April 2017 pricing on
new vehicles they include around $1500
in finance rebates that have a certain
credit requirement and you have to have
a certain score to claim this rebate
when looking at this and this is mostly
American manufactured automobiles
they're saying that the finance office
is credit score based and you must be
below 620 to qualify if you are over 620
you must add up to $1,500 to the price
so what they're saying is if you have a
credit score under 620 they're going to
take $1,500 off and if you're above 620
well you have to add $1,500 to the price
and let me give this varies between make
and model but what they're doing right
now is they're bringing in subprime
people and they're trying to push the
automobiles by giving them an incentive
because they realize the people with the
good credit well they're running out of
those people they need to bring those
people in who might not have great
credit or scores under 620 because
they're running out of people now think
about this for a second this lender is
actually trying to attract borrowers
with lower credit scores
than higher credit scores so they are
trying to sell a $55,000 vehicle to
those individuals in the sub subprime
category which is unbelievable because
what we're seeing is basically what we
saw back in the housing market before
2008 now industrial production well this
is continually dropping US manufacturing
production is dropping right now now
they expected manufacturing to rise by
0.4% but it only came in at point two
percent in July which completely missed
expectations and manufacturing
production actually shrank by negative
0.1 percent now the biggest driver of
the decline was a 3.6 percent slump in
motor vehicle production and we can see
right now the stock market even though
it's been down for the last couple of
days is continually moving up while
industrial production manufacturing is
declining at the same time but it
doesn't really matter because we know
the stock market is completely
manipulated and what we're seeing right
now is when we look at all these
different economic sectors like retail
for instance we see that this is having
major problems a lot of stores closing a
lot of people losing their jobs and it's
not going to online sales because
remember most of these corporations they
all have an online presence it's not
like oh we have a brick-and-mortar store
and we don't have an online presence
actually the brick-and-mortar stores
they have a little bit of an edge
because you could order something online
and actually drive over and pick it up
the same day instead of waiting for the
next day or two days to receive it in
the mail so it's not online sales what
is happening is the people around the
country who are losing their jobs who've
never recovered and those people who are
just coming into the mix they don't have
the funds because we know that wages
salaries they are declining and this is
genuine we're going to see each economic
sector continually decline as we move
throughout this year there is no
stopping it I know Trump is out there
and he's saying that all these jobs are
coming back he created a million jobs
again governments speak they like to
tell you everything that they're doing
but most of it is not true because we've
been looking at the economic facts we've
been looking at what has been happening
and we can see that the United States is
in a major decline actually the global
economy is in a major decline but of
course the illusion where the central
bank is pushing free money and
everything like that and stimulus it's
making it look like everything is fine
we've seen this before in different
companies we've seen it before in Ponzi
schemes and once again we have major
problems headed our way
for instance we have the debt ceiling
problem that's coming up are they going
to raise the debt ceiling most likely
yes is that going to improve anything no
they're just going to spend more money
and what's happening here is we've been
on this illusionary ride for a very long
time or coming off the Obama economy
where he told us that he's handing this
incredible economy off to Trump now
Trump could have turned around and said
listen this economy is a complete
disaster it's an illusion but I think
there'd be panic panic in the streets I
think the elite the corporate media
would have been it's all your fault
you're the one who did it Obama was
giving you this healthy economy you
destroyed it and I think right now Trump
is going along with the ride where he's
convincing everyone that yes this
economy is doing well in the meantime
and he's not doing a very good job at
this he's trying to bring back
manufacturing he's trying to make deals
to set this economy up for the
transition but you can see that there's
major major problems because basically
the corporate media the elite the deep
state they want him removed I mean it's
completely obvious from what is going on
here and what is happening is we are
approaching certain deadlines coming up
this fall with the budget with the debt
ceiling
with everything else Congress is going
to be coming back in
Labor Day and we're going to see the
fireworks we're going to see a lot
happening during that period of time and
we can see that the corporate media they
are primed and ready to blame everything
on Trump and I don't think they'll have
any problem whatsoever when things start
to really fall apart and I think the
central bank I think those who are in
power they are prepared and ready to
bring down the system and point the
finger towards Trump and I think this is
exactly what's going to happen we can
see that fingers are being pointed at
them right now and the entire country
right now is in complete chaos and the
corporate media and everyone else is
just keeping this up this is all
building and this will feed right into
the economy how what he's trying to do
with NAFTA and everything else is
completely destroying the economy
because we know that McCain and many
others are out there saying hey do not
touch NAFTA we don't want that touched
and we know this is the elite bread and
butter this is why they want the the TPP
this is why they were pushing for all
these trade deals because it makes them
a whole lot of money it doesn't help the
everyday person it doesn't help trade
with the United States because we can
see it's completely obvious that most of
the jobs have been sent overseas so we
are heading down this path and I think
things are going to really accelerate as
we enter the fall months and as we move
into the fall the winter is just going
to do going to deteriorate a lot more
and it's not going to improve whatsoever
we've been watching this for quite a
while and every holiday season every
summer season we can see that real
estate deteriorates a little bit more we
can see that retail has been
deteriorating quite a bit now I mean
it's really flashing red signals all
over the place we can see the tax
receipts coming into the government they
are dropping every single day tax
receipts coming into the state level
they are dropping every day because what
is happening here is as people lose
their full-time job and as wages
continually decline what happens people
pay less taxes as people lose their job
doesn't get part-time jobs or can't find
a job less taxes coming to the
government this is what we are seeing
right now this is why under Obama
they created fact Gatka because they
were looking for more tax revenue this
is why they went overseas and again
there wasn't that much out there they
thought it was going to be a lot more
and what is happening is the tax
receipts are continually declining and
as more and more people lose jobs in
retail more people lose jobs in
corporations because as we can see the
revenues coming in to corporations they
are not there the sales are not there
earnings revenue completely different
they can you know shut down plants lay
off people buy back their stocks make
their earnings look good but the sales
on the revenue they can't manipulate
that part and that has been the problem
all along just like the central banks
cannot manipulate people into going out
and spending their money it's just
completely impossible this is why
they're talking about helicopter money
this is why they're telling you hey why
don't you take a line of credit from
your appreciation from your real estate
holdings they're trying to do everything
possible to get you out there and spend
the money that you really don't have I
mean if you take an equity line of
credit you're just borrowing money it's
not really yours it's on paper and if
the real estate market comes down all
those people who took an equity line of
credit they're screwed they're
underwater but they don't care about
that they want you to take out loans
this is the way their system stays alive
that's why they always report on credit
more people are spending money how do
they know this because more people are
using their credit cards that doesn't
mean people are spending their own money
they're borrowing money to keep the
system alive they're not looking at how
much money people actually have and how
much they're actually spending because
that money is really not yours you never
had it in the first place and this is
why there's many people out there paying
off credit cards because they
continually go out and purchase and
purchase and purchase their they reach
the max on their credit cards and they
can't purchase anymore and they have to
start paying
it off but with the high interest rates
it's very very difficult and a lot of
the country I would say the majority of
the country this is the type of shape
they're in right now
where they're struggling to stay alive
every single day
how long can an economy survive it can't
survive that long on this type of
program on this type of an economy
eventually what will happen it will
break down and this is what we're seeing
you see it in small places like in
retail I mean that's a sure sign that
it's breaking down when people say you
know something I'm just not going to
spend the money because I really don't
have it anymore
I don't have the job I had before and
you see this on the front lines the
front line is retail because 70% of our
economy is made up of with people
spending their funds in retail so you
are seeing the sign that the economy is
in trouble this is the sign this is the
signal to let you know we have major
problems and of course the corporate
media the central bank tucum they want
to you know basically cover this up like
no no there's no problem don't look over
here just like we saw signs in 2008 the

was a sign something was wrong something
wrong with the subprime security in just
investments there was something wrong
with that people are leaving their homes
why these are signals the universe is
out there saying here is the problem I'm

what we've been seeing this is the first
signal you're going to see many more
we've been pointing them all out all
over the place and as this thing comes

disaster this is why you need to be

listen everyone thanks a lot for
